content.raw:
What version of nightly are you using?

I get near zero drift (between robot and vehicle) when running from debian packages below (`dpkg -l`):
~~~
ii  gazebo-nightly                           1.8.1~hg20130527r71c7d10527da-1~precise             3D dynamics simulator for robotics
ii  drcsim-nightly                           2.6.2~hg20130527r6710885de0eb-1~precise             Darpa Robotics Challenge (DRC) simulator
~~~

For reference, see this [5 minute video](http://youtu.be/CI7ONjJ-VHY) of Atlas sitting in the car produced from my last run using gazebo_1.8 ([8056:71c7d10527da](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/71c7d10527da)) and drcsim_2.6 (2709:6710885de0eb)  after executing similar commands:

~~~
roslaunch atlas_utils vrc_task_1.launch
rostopic pub --once /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: { x: -0.02, z: -0.12 }}'
rostopic pub -1 /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- nominal
~~~

As you can see from the video, there should be virtually no drift between robot and vehicle (well, not visually obvious to me anyways :).
